benchmark_details.name: STORM (Stimulating Trustworthy Ordinal Regression Ability of MLLMs for Universal Visual Rating)
benchmark_details.overview: STORM is a benchmark for evaluating multi-modal large language models on visual rating tasks. It includes 655K image-level pairs and QAs across 14 ordinal regression datasets in five visual rating domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the all-in-one and zero-shot performance of MLLMs in visual rating tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The definitions of labels for different domain tasks are diverse, impacting performance consistency.

data.source: 14 ordinal regression datasets across five visual rating domains.
data.annotation: Annotated via a mixture of expert annotation and automated processes.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predictions compared to ground truth ratings for visual content.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and lower MAE indicate better visual rating performance.
methodology.validation: The benchmark employs official training/testing splits when available and uses random splits otherwise.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset was collected for research purposes, ensuring no personally identifiable information is included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY 4.0 license for data, Apache-2.0 license for code.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: The dataset was created with appropriate consent procedures as described in Appendix H.
